h: Cops rushed 470 Road accident victims to hospitals in PCR vans in 18 months: Data
sub_h: At least 470 Road accident victims in the capital were shifted to nearby hospitals by the commissionerate police in the past 18 months, data shared by police shows. A bulk of the victims were sole earning members of their families.

h: ‘Road accident deaths dip in April-May than in 2022’
Road accident deaths went up 17% in 1st 3 months in Odisha
sub_h: Odisha witnessed a 17% rise in deaths due to Road accidents between January and March this year as compared to the first quarter in the previous year, according to the latest data compiled by the state police.

h: Cops get training to improve road crash probe skills
sub_h: Amid a spate of fatal Road accidents in the state, the transport department on Wednesday launched a 20-day training programme for police personnel to enhance their skills to investigate such cases.

h: Couple, five-year-old daughter killed in car-tanker collision in Odisha's Koraput
sub_h: The deceased have been identified as Jeypore natives, Satrughan Pradhan (35), his wife Rasmita (25) and their daughter Subhalaxmi (5), said police.

h: 7 of wedding party killed, 4 injured after their car falls into canal in Odisha's Sambalpur
sub_h: Seven people were killed and four injured, after their car fell into the Sasan canal at Sasan area in Sambalpur district, while they were returning after attending a marriage function in the wee hours of Friday.

h: Two dead, 10 injured in Road accident
In Odisha, two dead, 10 injured in Road accident
sub_h: Two persons died and 10 others were injured after the auto-rickshaw they were travelling in rolled into a 7ft-deep ditch near Manikapur under Gajapati district's R Udayagiri police station on Friday.

h: Seven from West Bengal killed in Road accident in Odisha
sub_h: Seven people from West Bengal died when a poultry van they were travelling in rammed into a stationary truck on Saturday morning at Neulipur Chhack on National High way-16 in Odisha's Jajpur district.

h: 2 killed, 40 injured as tourist bus falls off bridge in Odisha's Dhenkanal
sub_h: Two persons were killed and 40 others injured after a tourist bus fell off a bridge near Panchabati in Dhenkanal town on national highway-55 early on Monday morning.

h: Road accidents high, review safety steps: SC panel to Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
sub_h: The Supreme Court Committee on Road Safety has urged chief minister Naveen Patnaik to review the road safety scenario in Odisha in view of an alarming rise in accident fatalities in the state. The SC panel is likely to send some of its officials to the state in the next two weeks to inspect the compliance of its orders.

h: OHRC orders ₹5L to kin of girl killed in accident
sub_h: The Odisha Human Rights Commission (OHRC) is asking the state government to pay Rs. 5 lakh compensation to the parents of a plus III student who was run over by a truck in front of Ravenshaw University in September 2019. The commission is also asking the government to ensure better management of traffic, and to take other measures to prevent accidents like this from happening in the future.

h: Policy to probe fatal Road accidents
sub_h: The state government has decided to formulate a policy to conduct forensic investigation into road fatalities. The transport department has prepared a draft memorandum under the banner of Odisha Crash Investigation Policy, 2022 for approval of the government.

h: Odisha Road accident death toll rises to 7
sub_h: The death toll in the accident on the Sambalpur-Jharsuguda Biju Expressway in Odisha has increased to seven with three more people succumbing to injuries, police said on Saturday.

h: Odisha records 48 deaths per 100 Road accidents
sub_h: With an alarming 48 deaths per 100 accidents, higher than the national average of 36, Odisha is eyeing massive expansion of its trauma care facilities to reduce fatalities.

h: Odisha: Lensman Ashok Panda dies in Road accident
sub_h: Senior photo journalist Ashok Panda died in a Road accident on Friday morning, when he was on his way to Puri to cover the Rath Yatra.

h: Four killed, 11 injured in two Road accidents in Odisha
sub_h: Four persons were killed and 11 others injured in two separate Road accidents in Odisha's Subarnapur and Khurda districts on Tuesday, police said.

h: Road accident deaths up by 7% in first 5 months of 2022
sub_h: Deaths due to Road accidents increased by 7% from January to May this year compared to the corresponding period last year, prompting the transport department to seek a report from transport commissioner Arun Bothra on the reasons behind the rise in road fatalities.

h: Road accident fatalities rose by 12% in 2021: Data
sub_h: Deaths due to Road accidents increased by 12% across the state from January-October in 2021 as against the corresponding 10 months in 2020.

h: Death in Road accidents went up by 7.2% last year
sub_h: Fatality rate in Road accidents in Odisha increased by 7.24% in 2021 as compared to 2020. According to the statistics shared by the state police with the transport department, 5,081 people died in road mishaps last year as against 4,738 in 2020.

h: Road accident deaths in Odisha increase by 8.87% in first quarter
sub_h: Deaths due to Road accidents in Odisha increased by 8.87% in the first quarter of 2021 as compared to the corresponding period in 2020.

h: Speed up disposal of Road accident insurance claims, govt tells cops
sub_h: The state government has asked police to expedite the disposal of cases related to insurance claims made by victims of Road accidents.

h: Odisha to train 30,000 as first responders to Road accidents
sub_h: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Wednesday launched a road safety initiative here called Rakshak - a first responders' training programme. Under this initiative, at least 30,000 volunteers, staying or working at eateries and different business establishments located near accident-prone spots, will be trained as first responders to s.

h: Odisha: 9 dead, 13 injured after van overturns in Koratpur
sub_h: Nine people lost their lives on Sunday and 13 suffered injuries after a van overturned in Kotpad of Odisha's Koraput district.

h: Odisha govt stresses on joint inspection of Road accident spots
Odisha records 11% fall in Road accident deaths in 2020
sub_h: Fatality rate in Road accidents in Odisha dropped by nearly 11% in 2020 as compared to 2019. According to the statistics of the state police, 4738 persons were killed in road mishaps in the state last year as against 5333 deaths in 2019.

h: District monitoring committees to analyse Road accidents in Odisha
sub_h: The state government has decided to constitute expert committees in each district to analyse causes of Road accidents and suggest remedial measures to minimize such mishaps. Additional district magistrate (ADM) will head the committee in districts.

h: Odisha IAS officer saves life of Road accident victim on lockdown evening
Road accidents due to drink driving go up, but checking
Odisha govt seeks report from collectors on rising Road accident deaths
sub_h: The state government has expressed strong displeasure over the rise in Road accident deaths and sought explanations from district collectors within fifteen days. The government also came down heavily on the police and regional transport officers (RTOs) for poor enforcement drives against the traffic violators.

h: Seven killed in Road accidents in Odisha
sub_h: At least seven people, including a woman, were killed and as many seriously injured in separate Road accidents in Kendrapara, Ganjam, Balasore and Rayagada districts of Odisha since Wednesday, police said.

h: Road accident deaths go down in Odisha
sub_h: Number of deaths due to road mishaps reduced in October this year compared to the figures of last year by 18.69 per cent. Similarly, state witnessed 11.9 per cent less Road accident deaths in September this year against last September. Authorities attributed it to better implementation of traffic norms.

h: 10 drown, 3 killed in Road accident after Holi celebrations in Odisha
sub_h: At least 10 people drowned while bathing and three were killed in a Road accident after Holi celebrations in Odisha on Tuesday, police said.

h: 5 of family die in Kalahandi mishap
sub_h: Five members of a family were killed and two others seriously injured when the car in which they were travelling collided with a truck in Odisha's Kalahandi district early on Wednesday, police said.

h: Kendrapada: Couple killed in Road accident
sub_h: The couple was riding pillion.While Ganesh Das (57) of Deriki village died on the spot, his wife Lata Das (55) succumbed to her injuries on her way to SCB medical college and hospital in Cuttack.

h: Road accident deaths worry Odisha government
